newsitem.title: USA: Thermodynetics sees FY98 net above FY97.
newsitem.headline: Thermodynetics sees FY98 net above FY97.

text.p: Thermodynetics Inc said Tuesday that it expects net income for the year ending March 31, 1998 will exceed that of fiscal 1997, assuming that ongoing cost reduction efforts are successful and that there are no serious aberrations in order flow.

The company also said sales for the fiscal year ending March 1998 should be above those of fiscal 1997 because of new product applications scheduled to start shipping in the third and fourth quarters.
The company added that shipments for the second quarter ending in September are expected to be comparable to those of 1996.
In the first quarter ended June 30, it said sales of air conditioning-related product applications were adversely affected by a cooler than normal spring in certain areas of the United States.
The company reported net profit of $62,000 in its first fiscal quarter, versus net profit of $248,000 in the year-earlier period.
Thermodynetics sells tubing products for heat transfer processing, including surface-enhanced tubing, single and double wall coaxial condenser and evaporator coils, and heat recovery systems.
